alert.note: Alert for Kern (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Evacuation Immediate issued March 10 at 10:03AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Kern County Emergency Services of California. Este es un mensaje de emergencia, llame a 211. Gracias. The is a message from the Kern County Sheriff`s Office. Due to water levels of the Kern River impacting local communities, an Evacuation Order has been issued for Riverkern, California and low-lying areas of Kernville, California. Areas of Riverkern and low-lying areas of Kernville expected to be impacted are: South of Riverkern, between Sierra Way and Burlando Road, North of Kernville Airport. An Evacuation Order means that flooding is an immediate threat to life. An Evacuation Order is a lawful order to leave now and seek shelter away from the area. The area is lawfully closed to public access. An Evacuation Order will likely be the last order given. A shelter location is open at the Lake Isabella Senior Center. 6405 Lake Isabella Blvd, Lake Isabella, California 93240. Animal Services will assist with sheltering companion animals at the center. Evacuation transportation assistance for those residents with physical limitations will be offered until 11:30 AM. If you require evacuation assistance, please call the Aging and Adult Services hotline at 1-855-264-6565 before 11:30 AM. We cannot guarantee assistance will be offered after that time. If you have an emergency, call 911. If you have any questions about the content of this message, please contact Kern County Information and Referral Services at 2-1-1. Thank you.
